page.title: 11A Canal in Wolverhampton
page.content: There are several canals in Wolverhampton and one,the Stafford and Worcester,passes near to my home.The canal was started in 1766 and took six years to build.The depth of the canal is six feet.This only applies to the centre as the bed is in the shape of a V.The canal is 46 miles long and there are 41 locks.The canal has to be cleaned out once a year.The canal links the River Severn at Stourport to the River Mersey. Most of the boats are used for pleasure now,but occasionally a barge can be seen carrying coal.No longer are horses to be seen pulling boats but the tow paths can still be walked along. The busiest time of the year for the canal people is from May to September.
